garrett_bread_smell.speaker: Narrator
garrett_bread_smell.text: As fresh bread comes out of your oven, Garrett suddenly goes very still. His eyes close, and he breathes deep.

garrett_transported.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_transported.text: *Eyes still closed* For just a moment... I was home. In our kitchen. Eleanor was humming while she kneaded the dough.

garrett_opens_eyes.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_opens_eyes.text: *He opens his eyes, looking almost embarrassed* She had a recipe. Her 'Memory Bread,' she called it. Said it tasted like all our happiest moments.

garrett_recipe_story.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_recipe_story.text: Simple ingredients - herbs, honey, love. She'd make it for every special occasion. Birthdays. Anniversaries. The day we got the news about... *he stops*

choices.text: It sounds beautiful. Does the recipe still exist?
Some recipes carry more than ingredients.

garrett_has_recipe.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_has_recipe.text: *He reaches into his coat pocket, then hesitates* I carry it with me. Always. Her handwriting is on it. I could never... I can't use it. Or share it. It's all I have left of her hands.

garrett_agrees.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_agrees.text: Yes. Yes, they do. *He touches his chest where a pocket rests* I carry her recipe here. Next to my heart. I can't bring myself to make it. What if I get it wrong? What if it doesn't taste right anymore?

garrett_conflict.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_conflict.text: *His voice breaks* What if making it means she's really gone? As long as I don't make it, there's still... something waiting. Something unfinished between us.

garrett_leaves_quiet.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_leaves_quiet.text: Forgive me. I've said too much. I should... I should go. The memories are too close today.
